note.p: Nurseryman. Proprietor of Bagshot Nursery, Surrey, acquired in 1829 by his uncle Michael Waterer (1770–1842) and bequeathed to his father, John Waterer (1783–1868), who worked it as John Waterer and Sons with his four sons, Frederick (1822/3–71), Michael (1824/5–81; retired by April 1881), John, and Hosea (1830/1–77; retired by 1871). It specialised in American plants and rhododendrons.
